page.description: Skip over a sequence of alphanumeric characters. Returns number of characters skipped.
page.syntax: Chars_Skipped as N = SkipOverAlphaNum as n()

argument.name: Chars_Skipped
argument.description: The number of characters the offset has been moved.

page.discussion: The <StringScanner>.SkipOverAlphaNum() function moves the offset to the next non-alpha and non-numeric character and returns the number of characters that the offset has moved. The offset does not move if it already is pointing to a non-alpha and non-numeric character.
page.example: dim scanner as P dim txt as C txt = <<%text%This1234 is wonderful prose written by a technical writer of note. %text% scanner = stringscanner.create(txt) ? scanner.skipoveralphanum() = 8 ? scanner.GetToOffset() = "This1234" ? scanner.getremainder() =is wonderful prose written by a technical writer of note.
